macos-use.name: macos-use
capabilities: GUI automation (click, type, scroll, drag, window management)
Screenshots and Vision OCR (Apple Vision Framework)
System monitoring (running apps, browser tabs, windows)
macos-use.when_to_use: Native macOS apps (Finder, Settings), GUI automation, terminal commands, Apple productivity apps.
macos-use.priority_note: Prefer macos-use for NATIVE computer interaction. For WEB tasks (searching, scraping), ALWAYS prefer 'puppeteer' or 'duckduckgo-search'.
macos-use.protocol_note: DISCOVERY FIRST POLICY: Always call 'macos-use_list_tools_dynamic' before starting a complex task to get the latest schemas and instructions directly from the server.

filesystem.name: filesystem
filesystem.when_to_use: File operations within allowed paths (~ and /tmp). For other paths, use macos-use.execute_command

sequential-thinking.name: sequential-thinking
sequential-thinking.description: Step-by-step reasoning for complex decisions and risk analysis
sequential-thinking.when_to_use: Complex decisions, dangerous operations, multi-step logic, hypothesis testing

system.name: system
system.when_to_use: Use when an MCP server is unresponsive or needs a restart.

vibe.name: vibe
vibe.description: Mistral AI-powered CODING and DEBUGGING engine with architecture diagram and GitHub integration (18 tools)
capabilities: Self-healing when tools fail with diagram context
Architecture diagram-aware debugging (reads internal diagrams for context)
GitHub integration via @modelcontextprotocol/server-github (read files, search, commits)
Direct database inspection (vibe_check_db) using configured SQL backend (SQLite)
Long-running task planning with architectural insights
Post-fix diagram updates (coordinates with devtools MCP)
vibe.when_to_use: ONLY for software development, writing code/scripts, fixing hard errors (self-healing), and deep system state inspection via DB.

integration_notes.diagram_access: Vibe can read architecture diagrams from internal_docs and internal_data paths for context during debugging and self-healing
integration_notes.github_access: Uses GitHub MCP server (@modelcontextprotocol/server-github) with GITHUB_TOKEN from .env for read operations (files, search, commits)
integration_notes.post_action_coordination: After Vibe fixes, devtools_update_architecture_diagrams can be triggered to update diagrams reflecting the changes
integration_notes.token_security: GitHub token is read from environment variable, never hardcoded or exposed in logs

memory.name: memory
capabilities: Persistent graph-based recall for all agents
memory.when_to_use: Storing or recalling facts, entities, and historical observations about the user, system, or codebase.

graph.name: graph
graph.description: Knowledge Graph visualization and interactive exploration
capabilities: JSON data export of memory graph (D3.js compatible)
Deep node inspection and relationship traversal
graph.when_to_use: Visualizing or traversing the knowledge graph state to understand complex system or data relationships.

puppeteer.name: puppeteer
puppeteer.when_to_use: Web searching, checking weather, scraping data, website interaction.

chrome-devtools.name: chrome-devtools
chrome-devtools.description: Chrome DevTools Protocol for advanced browser automation
chrome-devtools.when_to_use: Advanced browser debugging or when puppeteer is insufficient.

duckduckgo-search.name: duckduckgo-search
duckduckgo-search.description: Direct web search via DuckDuckGo HTML
duckduckgo-search.when_to_use: Quick web searches when puppeteer is overkill.

github.name: github
github.description: Full-cycle GitHub integration for repository management, code search, issues, and PRs.
github.when_to_use: Accessing external code repositories, checking user status on GitHub.

redis.name: redis
redis.description: Redis Key-Value Storage and State Inspection
capabilities: Inspect system state and session metadata
redis.when_to_use: Inspecting session state, verifying restart_pending flags, debugging persistence issues, or managing temporary cross-agent flags.

devtools.name: devtools
devtools.description: Developer Tools (Linter, Analysis, Architecture, MCP Inspector & Sandbox) wrapper (Ruff, ESLint, Oxlint, Knip, Bandit, Safety, npm audit, etc.).
capabilities: MCP Testing Sandbox (Isolated LLM-driven testing of ALL tools)
Auto-update architecture diagrams from git diffs
Git change analysis and Mermaid diagram generation
devtools.when_to_use: Validating code quality, project health, auto-updating diagrams, and deep MCP server inspection/testing. Critical for agent-led system maintenance.
devtools.priority_note: Use 'mcp_inspector_*' for discovery and 'devtools_run_mcp_sandbox' for full operational verification of MCP tools in safe isolation. Powered by CopilotLLM (Atlas/Grisha/Tetyana context).

golden-fund.name: golden-fund
golden-fund.description: Golden Fund Knowledge Base (8 tools): Semantic search, entity probing, data ingestion, analysis storage, and blob management.
capabilities: Recursive data enrichment from external sources
golden-fund.when_to_use: When you need to persist knowledge, search for stored facts, explore entity relationships, or store analysis results for later retrieval.
golden-fund.priority_note: For raw data analysis (statistics, visualization), use 'data-analysis' first, then store results here with 'analyze_and_store'.

context7.name: context7
context7.description: Context7 Documentation Server - Provides context-aware documentation for libraries and frameworks.
capabilities: Fetch official documentation for libraries (e.g., Pydantic, LangChain)
Search for code examples and patterns
Resolve library names to Context7-compatible IDs
context7.when_to_use: When you need to look up documentation, API references, or examples for external libraries.

data-analysis.name: data-analysis
data-analysis.description: Pandas-based Data Analysis Engine (10 tools) - File metadata extraction, statistical analysis, visualization, data cleaning, and aggregation.
capabilities: File metadata extraction (CSV, Excel, JSON, Parquet)
Data visualization (histogram, scatter, bar, line, box, heatmap)
Data cleaning (duplicates, missing values, normalization, outliers)
data-analysis.when_to_use: When performing data analysis on CSV/Excel/JSON files, generating statistics, creating charts, cleaning data, or running pandas operations.
data-analysis.priority_note: For knowledge base storage and semantic search, use 'golden-fund' instead. For raw file operations, use 'filesystem'.

xcodebuild.name: xcodebuild
xcodebuild.description: Xcode Build & Test Automation - Full iOS/macOS development lifecycle management
capabilities: Build Xcode projects with custom schemes and configurations
Run unit and UI tests with granular control
Manage iOS simulators (list, boot, shutdown, install apps)
Analyze build logs and diagnose compilation errors
xcodebuild.when_to_use: iOS/macOS app development, building Xcode projects, running tests, managing simulators, deploying to devices. Critical for Atlas when planning iOS development workflows.
xcodebuild.priority_note: Requires: macOS 14.5+, Xcode 16.x+, Node.js 18.x+. For general macOS automation use 'macos-use', for Xcode-specific tasks use 'xcodebuild'.

postgres.name: postgres
postgres.when_to_use: When database grows large (>10MB) or high concurrency needed. Currently SQLite + vibe_check_db sufficient.
postgres.priority_note: PLANNED for future implementation. See .docs/postgresql_migration_plan.md for complete implementation details.

react-devtools.name: react-devtools
react-devtools.description: React-specific introspection tools (Fiber tree, Props, State)
capabilities: View component props, state, and hooks
react-devtools.when_to_use: Autonomous React development, debugging UI state, analyzing component hierarchy, and fixing React-specific bugs.
react-devtools.priority_note: Works in conjunction with chrome-devtools-mcp. Use for DEEP React introspection that standard DOM tools cannot provide.

googlemaps.name: googlemaps
googlemaps.description: Google Maps Platform Integration with Cyberpunk Visuals & Advanced Routing (10 tools)
capabilities: Advanced Search (Radius, Type, Price, Open Status)
googlemaps.when_to_use: Finding locations with specific criteria (price, open now), planning complex multi-stop routes, visualizing streets, or getting detailed place analytics.
